content:
{"updates": [{"pattern": ".*", "multiple": true, "replacement": "🔹 **Try to monetize my dog on social media—he has viral potential.** (This idea initially came up while evaluating a pet-focused franchise opportunity. AI recognized that my dog’s unique abilities could be an asset to marketing that venture. It later reframed this as a **low-risk, high-reward** way to learn social media, experiment with AI automation, and explore an alternative income stream—while simply sharing something I already do: spending time with my dog and my family. Even if it doesn’t take off, the skills learned will still be valuable in adapting to a world where personal branding and AI-driven content creation are becoming necessary skills.)

That’s when I realized: **Why not turn my future over to AI entirely? Not just learn it, but let it guide me back to generating income?**

### **🔹 The AI Career Experiment: What Happens Next**

📌 **Is the Singularity Coming Sooner Than We Think?**
As I’ve been diving deeper into AI’s capabilities, I can’t shake the feeling that the rapid advances we’re seeing could mean the Singularity is much closer than most people expect. Kurzweil predicted 2045, but what if it’s 2028? I know that sounds crazy to most people, but if AI keeps advancing at its current pace, it almost feels like all we need is something to link AI to the brain—maybe call it 'BrainLink' (I’m terrible at branding, but maybe someone really smart with a lot of money will figure that out?) AI is already reasoning, designing its own improvements, and replacing white-collar jobs at an accelerating rate. If I don’t embrace it now, I risk getting left behind. That’s why I’m not just adapting to AI—I’m letting it guide me.

📌 **1️⃣ I will document my AI-driven job search and automation journey.**\
📌 **2️⃣ I will apply AI to social media growth and business process automation.**\
📌 **3️⃣ AI will determine how I allocate my time based on the response to this post and my dog’s social media engagement.**

If AI is going to shape the future, I’m embracing it fully.

### **🔹 How You Can Help**

1️⃣ **If you know of AI-driven roles where I can help companies adopt, implement, or optimize AI tools, let’s talk. Ideally, I’m looking for opportunities at companies that are either developing AI solutions or aggressively implementing them.** I’m open to starting over in salary—getting back to work is my priority. My background aligns with:

- **AI Implementation & GTM Strategy** (AI Solutions Consultant, AI Adoption Specialist, GTM Strategy Lead)
- **AI-Powered Process Automation** (AI Workflow Strategist, AI Automation Consultant, Business AI Specialist)
- **AI-Driven Growth & Revenue Strategy** (AI Growth Strategist, Revenue Ops AI Lead, AI-Powered Sales Enablement)

2️⃣ **Engage with this post.** Like, comment, or share—it will help me reach the right people.

3️⃣ **If you love dogs, check out Chewy’s channels.** If AI is right and he does go viral, it could help sustain my family while I transition careers.

🐶 **Follow The Wide Retriever:**\
📍 **Instagram:** [Insert IG handle]\
📍 **TikTok:** [Insert TikTok handle]\
📍 **YouTube Shorts:** [Insert YouTube handle]

🚀 **This is an experiment in AI, career transformation, and content.**

💡 **I’ll also be sharing this on X (Twitter). If that’s your preferred platform, follow along here:** [Insert X handle] If you’re interested in how AI is reshaping careers, follow along—I’ll be sharing everything I learn.

💬 **Have you ever taken AI’s career advice? What’s the most unexpected thing it has suggested?** Let’s discuss.

*(Attaching Chewy’s latest video—because if AI is right, this might be part of my future too.)*"}]}
